New Records: Jason Holder achieved career-best bowling figures of 4 for 7 in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took 4 wickets for 7 runs, including two consecutive balls.
Brandon King scored an unbeaten 52 off 47 balls.
West Indies won by 9 wickets with 17 balls remaining.
England were bowled out for 103, their fourth-lowest T20I total.
Sheldon Cottrell bowled Jason Roy with a fuller-length inswinger.
Chris Jordan hit three sixes in as many overs.
Adil Rashid took the only wicket for England, dismissing Shai Hope.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was a significant morale boost for West Indies after losing an ODI series to Ireland.
England's performance was seen as a continuation of their recent struggles, including their Test team’s loss in the Ashes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown.
West Indies had been routed for 55 in their most recent meeting with England at the T20 World Cup in November.
England's Powerplay performance was notably poor, losing key wickets early.
